automation.name: Automation
automation.description: This module adds features to minecraft's automation prospects.

features.name: Dispenser Planting
features.description:
Dispensers can plant seeds on the correct type of soil.

This works for all overworld seeds, on Tilled Soil, Nether Wart, on Soul Sand, and Chorus Flower on End stone. Cocoa Beans can be planted if there's a Jungle Wood block in front of the dispenser.

features.name: Piston Block Breakers
features.description:
Pistons pusing an Iron Rod will have it work as a drill of sorts, breaking any blocks in front in the direction the rod is facing. These can break anything the piston can push.

Iron Rods are crafted with 2 Iron Ingots and an End Rod, or just 3 Iron Ingots if you enable easy mode in the config.

Note: In 1.10, a normal End Rod block is used instead.

features.name: Ender Watcher
features.description:
The Ender Watcher is a new redstone input block. It emits a full redstone signal if a player is looking directly at it.

It's crafted with an Eye of Ender, Redstone and Blocks of Biotite (from the World module, or Obsidian if not enabled).

features.name: Hungry Animals
features.description: Animals that have a breeding food assigned to them will eat it from the floor at any time they can have it fed manually, provided the food is nearby.

features.name: Obsidian Pressure Plates
features.description: Pressure Plates made with obsidian will only trigger when Players walk over them.

features.name: Weather Sensor
features.description:
The Weather Sensor is crafted with Purpur Slabs, Biotite (from the World module, or Obsidian if not enabled) and Glass. It works like a Daylight Sensor, but it emits a full redstone signal if it's raining or snowing.

Right clicking it inverts its output.

features.name: Pistons Move Tile Entities
features.description:
Pistons are allowed to move Tile Entities (blocks with extra data attached, like Chests or Furnaces).
Attempting to move a block to an invalid position will cause it to break and drop its contents (e.g. trying to create a triple chest).
Monster Spawners can't be moved this way.

For a block that pistons can't move, now that furnaces can't be used, look into Sturdy Stone in the Building module.

features.name: Dispensers Place Blocks
features.description:
Dispensers are allowed to place blocks in the world. Any blocks that already had a placement behaviour, like TNT, are ignored.

The blocks are rotated so they're placed forward from the dispenser.

building.name: Building
building.description: This module adds new structural building blocks.

features.name: Bark Blocks
features.description: Log-type blocks with the log "bark" texture on all sides. Crafted with a 2x2 of the respective log. Can be turned into walls.

features.name: Carved Wood
features.description: Carved Wood is a cornerstone type block for wood, made with a 2x2 of the respective wood slab.

features.name: Charred Nether Bricks
features.description: Charred Nether Bricks bring a slate-like tone for a dark but not black block. Crafted with a Nether Brick (block) and a Fire Charge. They can also be used for stairs and slabs.

features.name: Clay Shingles
features.description:
"Tile" style blocks for Hardened Clay and all colors of Stained Clay. They can all be turned into stairs and slabs, and look great for roofs.

4 Blocks are crafted with a 2x2 of the respective Hardened/Stained Clay block.

features.name: Iron Plates
features.description: Iron Plate blocks can be created with 8 Iron Ingots in the donut shape, this recipe outputs 24 plates. Iron Plates can also be turned into stairs and slabs.

features.name: Midori Blocks
features.description:
Midori Blocks are a green counterpart to Purpur. These are made with Cactus Green, with the same recipes as the Purpur blocks.

Midori means "green" in Japanese.

features.name: More Sandstone
features.description:
(Red) Sandstone was begging for more variants, so now we have Polished Sandstone and Sandstone Bricks. Polished Sandstone is crafted with a square shape of Sandstone, whereas Sandstone Bricks are crafted with the standard brick recipe using Polished Sandstone. Of course these recipes are the same for Red Sandstone.

Polished Sandstone can be used for slabs, whereas Sandstone Bricks can be used for slabs and stairs.

(not pictured, variants for Soul Sandstone as well, if it's enabled)

features.name: More Stone Bricks
features.description: Stone Bricks for Granite, Diorite and Andesite. Crafted with a 2x2 of the Polished variant. All of them can be used for stairs, slabs, and walls.

features.name: Polished Stone
features.description: Created with 2 Stone Slabs, similarly to Chiseled Sandstone. Looks like the top of the Stone Slab texture on all sides.

features.name: Sandy Bricks
features.description: Bricks with a sandy tone, crafted with a Brick block and a Sand Block. They can also be used for stairs, slabs, and walls.

features.name: Snow Bricks
features.description: Snow Bricks, for all your igloo and winter wonderland needs. They can also be used for stairs, slabs, and walls.

features.name: Soul Sandstone
features.description:
Sandstone made of Soul Sand. All recipes are as expected.

Soul Sandstone can be turned into Stairs, Slabs, and Walls.

features.name: Stairs, Slabs, and Walls
features.description:
Stairs, Slabs, and Walls for a bunch of vanilla materials: Stone, Granite, Diorite, Andesite, End Bricks, Prismarine, Prismarine Bricks, and Dark Prismarine.

Walls for, aside from all the previous: Purpur, Bricks, Quartz, Sandstone, Red Sandstone, and Stone Bricks.

As of 1.10, Red Nether Bricks also get Stairs and Slabs.

features.name: Sugar Cane Blocks
features.description: A 3x3 of Sugar Canes creates a Sugar Cane Block. These can be turned into stairs, slabs and walls. You can also turn them back into Sugar Canes, if you want.

features.name: Thatch
features.description: Thatch is created via a 2x2 of Wheat. It can be used for stairs and slabs or turned back into 4 Wheat.

features.name: Vertical Wooden Planks
features.description:
Putting 3 wooden planks in a vertical line creates 3 Vertical Wooden Planks. Doing the same reverts it.

If Stained Wooden Planks is enabled, vertical versions of those are also added.

features.name: Duskbound Blocks
features.description:
Purple looking blocks made from Purpur and Obsidian, fully featured with stair, slab and wall variants.

Also includes Duskbound Lamps, made with Duskbound Blocks and Ender Pearls.

features.name: Netherwrought Stone
features.description: A red block for nether-ish style building, made with 4 Netherrack, with a chaotic textured brick variant. Includes stair, slab and wall variants.

features.name: Stained Wooden Planks
features.description: Dyed Wooden Planks of all 16 colors, featuring a pastel color palette so you can actually build with them without making your eyes hurt! All include stair and slab variants.

features.name: Sturdy Stone
features.description: A hard stone block made with 4 Stone and 4 Cobblestone (outputs 4). The block has the Furnace Texture, and can not be moved by Pistons.

decoration.name: Decoration
decoration.description: This module adds new decorative building blocks.

features.name: All The Bookshelves
features.description: You can now make Bookshelves out of all wood types. All of these bookshelves work for the Enchanting Table too.

features.name: All The Chests
features.description: Just like trapdoors and bookshelves, this allows you to make chests of all wood types. It also adds a recipe to make 4 chests at once, using 8 wood logs of the respective type in the same donut pattern.

features.name: All The Trapdoors
features.description: This allows you to make trapdoors of all wood blocks rather than just Oak. It also changes the recipe to create 6 rather than 2 trapdoors, since doors make 3.

features.name: Blaze Lantern
features.description: The Blaze Lantern is the fire equivalent of the Sea Lantern. Crafted with a + of Blaze Powder and Blaze Rods in the corners, like a Sea Lantern.

features.name: Block of Charcoal
features.description:
It's a Block of Charcoal. Made with 9 Charcoal. Not sure what you expected here.

Similarly to Netherrack, this block retains fire.

features.name: Colored Beds
features.description: Beds made with different types of wool will have that wool color. If you mix wool types you'll get a white bed instead.

features.name: Colored Item Frames
features.description: Item Frames can be combined with any Dye to color them. All functionality remains the same.

features.name: Flat Item Frames
features.description: Item Frames and Colored Item Frames can be placed on floors and ceilings. The top of the frame is oriented north in both cases.

features.name: Iron Ladders
features.description: Iron Ladders can be crafted with the H shape of Iron Ingots. They work like normal ladders, except that they can stand by themselves as long as there is an Iron Ladder on top of them, like in the picture.

features.name: Leaf Carpet
features.description: Leaf Carpet can be made with all types of leaves in the same recipe as wool carpet. It can be harvested by hand and has no collision box.

features.name: Lit Redstone Lamp
features.description: Combining a Redstone Lamp with a Redstone Torch creates a Lit Redstone lamp, that's always emitting light.

features.name: Nether Brick Fence Gate
features.description: A Fence Gate made of Nether Bricks. Crafted with Nether Brick blocks in the place of planks and Nether Brick Fences in the place of Sticks. The recipe outputs 2.

features.name: New Banner Motifs
features.description: New banner motifs can be made using Dragon Heads, Eyes of Ender, Iron Swords, and Iron Chestplates, alongside the chosen color of dye.

features.name: Paper Walls
features.description:
Paper Walls use the "pane" look, which lets you make fancy oriental style buildings. Thanks to the new 1.9 change that makes standalone panes look like poles, they can also be used to make makeshift "tiki torches".

These are crafted with 3 Paper in the middle row, and Sticks covering the rest of the grid.

management.name: Management
management.description: This module adds inventory management features.

features.name: Chest Buttons
features.description:
Four buttons are added to Chest interfaces. From top to bottom, they do the following:
  • (not pictured) Sort the chest, if the Sorting Button feature is enabled.
  • Extract all items from the chest that you have at least one of in your inventory.
  • Deposit your entire inventory (not hotbar, armor or off-hand) in the chest.
  • Same as the previous, but only for items that the chest has at least one of inside.

features.name: Delete Items
features.description:
Pressing Ctrl+DELETE while hovering over an item will delete that item from your inventory. The item is deleted forever, this can't be undone.

How do you even make an image for this?

features.name: Dropoff Button
features.description:
A "Dropoff" button is added to the inventory screen. Pressing this button deposits everything in your inventory (not hotbar, armor or off-hand) in nearby chests. The range it stores in is similar to the player's reach, so it won't store items in chests the player can't open. The closest chests are picked first.

If Shift is held, it stores items in "smart" mode, meaning it'll only store items in chests that already have at least one of that item.

This feature can be disabled from clients using /gamerule quark_allowDropoff false

features.name: F to Switch
features.description: Pressing F on an item in the inventory swaps it with your off-hand item, just as if you'd pressed F outside of the inventory. This uses the same keybind used for that purpose.

features.name: Favorite Items
features.description: Alt-clicking an item will make it a "Favorite Item". Favorite items are not deposited by the Dropoff button or the last two Chest buttons.

features.name: Item Linking
features.description: Pressing Shift+T (or whatever your Chat key is set to) while looking at an item in an inventory links that item to chat. Other players can hover over it to check it out.

features.name: Sorting Button
features.description:
A "Sort" button is added to the inventory screen. Pressing this button sorts your inventory, excepting your hotbar.

Sorting is done via a category system, in which items are placed based on what category they fit in (food, tool, armor, block, etc.). Each category also has its own sorting rules, e.g. food will get sorted based on which is more filling; tools will get sorted based on which one is the best, or has more durability.

features.name: Better Crafting Shift-Clicking
features.description: Shift-clicking an item in your inventory in the crafting table interface will move it to the crafting grid, and not the hotbar.

features.name: Hotbar Changer
features.description: Pressing the X key (rebindable) will show your entire inventory above your hotbar. You can then press 1, 2, or 3, to switch that respective inventory row with your hotbar. Pressing X again will hide the 3 additional rows with no change.

tweaks.name: Tweaks
tweaks.description: This module tweaks various gameplay elements.

features.name: Angry Creepers
features.description: Creepers turn red when they're about to explode.

features.name: Armed Armor Stands
features.description: Armor Stands placed by the Armor Stand item will have arms.

features.name: Burning Baby Zombies
features.description: Baby Zombies will die in sunlight like their parents.

features.name: Burning Torches
features.description: Torches can be burnt in furnaces for 2 items each.

features.name: Chicken Shearing
features.description: Chickens can be sheared. Doing so has them take 1 damage and drop 1 feather. You can do this as many times as you want while the chicken doesn't die. Chickens that have been sheared will not drop feathers upon death.

features.name: Chicken Shedding
features.description: Chickens shed feathers periodically, similarly to how they lay eggs.

features.name: Clay Conversion
features.description: Clay blocks can be converted into the Clay item via crafting.

features.name: Double Door Opening
features.description: Double doors open together when right clicked.

features.name: Effective Dragon's Breath
features.description: Dragon's Breath will not leave behind a bottle when brewed with, so it doesn't mess up all brewing automation systems.

features.name: Enderman Anti-Cheese
features.description: Going under a 2 block high area while being attacked by an enderman will have the enderman teleport you to it. This ability is negated in Easy mode.

features.name: Better Stone Tool Crafting
features.description: Stone Tools can be crafted with all stone types, as well as flint. (Only flint is available on versions older than 1.11)

features.name: Food Tooltip
features.description: Food items show how much they heal in their tooltip.

features.name: Glass Shards
features.description:
Glass drops shards. Stained Glass will drop shards of the respective type. Crafting them in a 2x2 creates a Glass block back.

The shards act like Glowstone Dust, in which Fortune will let you get more, and Silk Touch will just drop the block.

features.name: Greener Grass
features.description:
Grass is greener on the Quark side. Biome colors are still respected, but are greener non the less.

There's also config options to enable Alpha style grass, which gives you the Minecraft Alpha vibe, or to manually set the grass color.

features.name: Hoe Harvesting
features.description: Breaking grass or crops with a hoe will break a 3x3 of them. A Diamond Hoe will break a 5x5 instead.

features.name: Improved Mount HUD
features.description: While on a mount, your food display is still shown. Furthermore, while on a horse, the jump bar is only shown while holding down the jump key, the XP bar is shown otherwise.

features.name: Jump Boost Step Assist
features.description: Having Jump Boost II on your character will allow you to go up 1 block high gaps, like Horses can.

features.name: Knock on Doors
features.description: Left clicking a door with an empty hand will have you "knock". This makes a bit of a louder sound than if you left clicked any other block, but nowhere as infuriating as opening and closing it.

features.name: Ladder Drop Down
features.description:
Right clicking a ladder with another ladder will place it under the one right clicked, as long as there is space for it.

This allows for ladders to be properly extended downwards without finnicky shift-click managing.

features.name: Ladder Sliding
features.description: When on a ladder, if not moving or sneaking, looking down will have you go down the ladder faster.

features.name: Minecart Block Placement
features.description: Right clicking a normal minecart with a block that can go in it (Chest, Hopper, etc) will turn the normal cart into that type of cart.

features.name: No Potion Shift
features.description:
Prevents potion effects from shifting your inventory to the side.

Does literally the same as the mod of the same name. It has the same one line of code even!

features.name: Proper Stair Math
features.description: Stairs make 8 rather than 4. Why did they even make 4 in the first place? How does that even work? Anyway, this modifies every stair recipe in the game.

features.name: Quick Armor Swapping
features.description: Right clicking an armor stand while sneaking will swap all armor and your off hand item quickly.

features.name: Safe Mounts
features.description: Mounts are immune to attacks from riders. No more shooting your own horse!

features.name: Shave Snow Layers
features.description: Right clicking a block of snow (full block or layered block) with a shovel will remove a layer from it.

features.name: Sheep Armor
features.description: Sheep that have wool also have a bit of armor added to them, making them take less damage.

features.name: Sign Editing
features.description: Right Clicking a Sign lets you edit it.

features.name: Slabs to Blocks
features.description:
Slabs can be converted back to their respective blocks. These recipes are generated dynamically for every slab type in the game.

In the case that there's already a recipe of this sort (like Chiseled Sandstone), that recipe will be the one used for crafting.

features.name: Stackable Minecarts
features.description: All types of Minecarts can be stacked up to 16.

features.name: Stairs to Blocks
features.description: Stairs can be converted back to their respective blocks. These recipes are generated dynamically for every stair type in the game.

features.name: Subtler Shields
features.description: Shields have been pushed back a bit, so they don't use up as much of your screen when equipped and not blocking.

features.name: Texture Changes
features.description:
Quark generates a "low priority resource pack", changing some textures to less rough or more sensible variants. Each of these can be turned off individually, and will be overriden by any other resource pack you load on top. The current changes are as follows:
  • 1.8 Stones (smoother texture)
  • Bricks (some color variance)
  • Glass (less spots)
  • Pistons (model swap to look like the pocket edition ones, sticky piston sides, 1.11 only)
  • Pumpkin (disables the face, off by default)
  • Bow (improved pull animation, with more frames)

features.name: Map Tooltip
features.description: Hovering over a filled map in an inventory renders that map above the tooltip.

features.name: Villagers follow Emerald Blocks
features.description: Holding an Emerald Block causes nearby villagers to follow the player, much like animals do for food items.

features.name: Sponges dry in the Nether
features.description: Title says it all, really. Placing a sponge in the nether will cause it to dry out without needing fuel.

features.name: Better Shulker Box Tooltip
features.description: Shulker Boxes show their items while being hovered in an inventory display rather than displaying the item names on the tooltip.

vanity.name: Vanity
vanity.description: This module adds vanity features for your character.

features.name: Boat Sails
features.description: Right clicking a Boat with a Banner adds it as a Sail. The sail is decorative only and is dropped when the boat is destroyed.

features.name: Dyable Elytra
features.description: The Elytra can be dyed with any of the 16 dyes. You can dye it as many times as you want.

features.name: Dyed Item Names
features.description: Combining an item with a dye in an anvil has the item's tooltip name take that dye's color. This costs 3 levels.

features.name: Emotes
features.description:
In the corner of the Chat menu there's a button to open an emote panel with 10 different emotes your character can do. In this picture, Alex is doing the "Wave" emote.

Each emote is also assigned a key binding. Pressing that key will do the emote without you having to open the chat menu. By default all emote keybinds are unset and must be set manually.

features.name: Firework Duplication
features.description:
Empty Fireworks can be crafted with already made ones to duplicate them. This works like Banners, in which the origin firework will not get used up.

Both fireworks need to have the same flight duration for this to work.

features.name: Stair Chairs
features.description:
Right clicking a stair block facing up, with empty hands, will let you sit down on it.

#BENCHES

features.name: Witch Hats
features.description:
Witches have a rare chance to drop their hat on death (same as a Wither Skeleton Skull drop).

Aside from being an awesome fashion accessory, the hat provides leather level armor, high enchantability and a built in 50% resistance to potions of harming from witches.

world.name: World
world.description: This module adds world generation features.

features.name: Basalt
features.description:
Basalt spawns in the Nether in large clusters. It works like the overworld rocks (Granite, Diorite, and Andesite), and the recipes for it are similar.

Combining Basalt with Quartz makes Andesite. Combining Cobblestone with Biotite (Coal if not enabled) makes Basalt.

features.name: Big Mushrooms in Swamps
features.description: Big mushrooms of both types will generate in Swamps, similarly to the Console Edition.

features.name: Blazes in the Nether
features.description: Blazes spawn naturally in the Nether. You won't get a lot of them, but they're definitely there to make the nether a bit more perilous.

features.name: Buried Treasure
features.description: Treasure Maps can be found on Temples and Strongholds. These are special maps with an X on them. Travel to that X to uncover some buried treasure (a chest with Dungeon loot).

features.name: Crystal Caves
features.description:
Crystal Caves are rare underground scenery pieces. The caves will spawn with 2 (out of 8) colors of Cave Crystal block and a bunch of ores. The Cave Crystal blocks are a light source and look cool!

If the feature is enabeld, they can be used to craft Colored Runes (from the misc module)

features.name: Default World Options
features.description:
All the options available for the Customized world type can be tweaked in the mod's configuration. These apply to the normal world type.

This is mostly a modpack maker feature, as all these options are already available through the Customized world type.

features.name: Depth Mobs
features.description:
Ashen (left) and Dweller (right) mobs can spawn underground at low depth levels (below Y=20). These are both rare spawns compared to their normal counterparts.

The Ashen is a Skeleton variant that shoots Blindness arrows, which last for 2.5 seconds.

The Dweller is a Zombie variant that spawns invisible, but loses the invisibility after it attacks or is attacked. It also has a bit more armor.

features.name: Dungeon Variety
features.description:
The Dungeon generator is suplemented by a random pick from Noodlor's Dank Dungeons, they still contain the same spawners and the same loot, but have new styles.

The vanilla dungeons will still spawn.

features.name: Ender Biotite
features.description:
Ender Biotite is a renewable ore that does not spawn naturally. Clusters of it will, instead, get scattered across the main End island when an Ender Dragon dies.

Similarly to Nether Quartz, Ender Biotite drops an item, which can be used for crafting or to create Decorative Biotite Blocks, black quartz style blocks.

features.name: Guardians in Oceans
features.description:
Guardians spawn naturally in Oceans, rarely. See the previous feature.

If this feature is enabled, the Guardian sound is changed to not ignore distance for its volume (it does so in vanilla), so it's no longer a massive pain if you live near the ocean, or an ocean monument.

features.name: Pirates
features.description:
Pirate ships will spawn in Ocean biomes. In the ships you'll find skeleton pirates, booty and hats. Yes, you can wear their hats, if you get them to drop.

Possible booty includes weapons, food, gold, TNT, Fire Charges, Pirate Hats and Sponges (rare).

Pirate mobs don't despawn.

features.name: Realistic World Type
features.description:
Alongside Amplified or Large Biomes, "Realistic" is a new world type that creates semi-realistic terrain. Expect rolling hills and very tall mountains. The cloud height is incresed to 260 in this world type.

If you want to use this in a server, set the world type to "quark_realistic".

features.name: Stone Revamp
features.description:
Diorite, Granite, and Andesite will now spawn in really large, uncommon clusters, rather than all over the place in small bits. Furthermore, two new stones are added to the mix: Marble and Limestone (pictured). These last two can be used for anything the first three can.

As of 1.11, the stones will generate based on biome. You can find the table for which stones generate in which biomes here.

features.name: Underground Clay
features.description: Clay generates in patches underground, similarly to Dirt, albeit less often.

features.name: Wraiths and Curses
features.description:
Wraiths are mobs that will spawn rarely in the nether, on Soul Sand. They spawn in packs and attack like a Zombie, albiet moving faster. When they strike their target, they inflict a short Slowness debuff and knock themselves back. Fighting them standing still is a bad idea. They also don't have their own sounds, instead appropriating other mobs' sounds.

Wraiths drop a Soul Bead item. Right clicking it will break it, and inflict a Curse debuff on the player for 20 minutes. Mobs in a 64 block radius of a player with Curse will spawn ignoring light levels and other conditions (like slime chunk restrictions). Curse can not be cleansed with Milk.

features.name: Underground Biomes
features.description:
Underground biomes are uncommon spawns in mid level underground, spawning based on their respective overworld biomes. There are currently 9 underground cave styles you may find.

This feature is too large to fit in a single card, so in order to properly show them all, please check out the album, by clicking the yellow picture button in the bottom of the card.

misc.name: Miscellaneous
misc.description: This module adds miscellaneous features that didn't fit in any other modules.

features.name: Endermites into Shulkers
features.description: Endermites will rarely bury into Purpur Blocks, much like how Silverfish bury into stone. When they do, they fuse with the block, forming a Shulker.

features.name: Auto-jump Toggle Keybind
features.description:
Pressing the B key will toggle your auto-jump feature. A small HUD element will show up telling you whether it's currently active or not.

This is just a normal keybind, so you can change it to whatever you want.

features.name: Snow Golem Heads
features.description: Named Snow Golems equipped with a Pumpkin will drop a player head with the same name as theirs, if killed by a Witch.

features.name: Monster Note Blocks
features.description:
Note Blocks with heads attached to their side will emit the respective mob's sound instead of a note.

The mob sound's pitch is based on the note block pitch.

features.name: Panorama Maker
features.description:
Holding Ctrl and Shift (or Cmd and Shift in a Mac) while taking a screenshot takes a "Panorama Screenshot". Panorama screenshots are split into 6 low resolution images and can be used for resource packs to change the title screen look.

Furthermore, when loading the game, a random panorama screenshot the player has taken will be chosen to replace the vanilla panorama in the title screen. Panorama screenshots are stored in a "panoramas" folder under the "screenshots" folder, and sorted by folders. Renaming one of the inner folders to "main_menu" will make that image always show up in the title screen.

features.name: Ancient Tomes
features.description:
Ancient Tomes are a rare loot item from dungeons and stronghold libraries. They come only in the highest level of an enchantment and can be combined with an Enchanted Book of the same enchantment to create one that's a level higher than the max. This costs 35 levels to create the book and an extra 35 to apply it.

The tomes can not be directly applied to an item. They also never contain enchantments that have no level or "Protection" type enchantments.

features.name: Colored Runes
features.description: Colored Runes are a rare loot item from dungeons, temples and nether fortresses. They can be applied to enchanted items in an anvil, and doing so changes the color of the enchantment glint from purple to the color of the rune. These come in all 16 colors of the spectrum.

features.name: Slime in a Bucket
features.description:
Right clicking a tiny slime with a bucket puts it in there. It remains quiet, but will start jumping inside the bucket if you find yourself in a slime chunk.

The slime can also be deployed back into the world by right clicking on a block. You can also use it as a replacement for slimeballs, you monster.

features.name: Extra Arrows
features.description:
Three new arrows are added:
  • Ender Arrow: Crafted with an Arrow and an Ender Pearl, works like an ender pearl, but goes farther, since it's an arrow, yay.
  • Explosive Arrow: Crafed with an Arrow and two pieces of Gunpowder, explodes where it hits.
  • Torch Arrow: Crafted with an arrow and a Torch, places a torch where it hits. If it can't, it stays there so it can be picked up.
These can all be fired from dispensers, and will get used up even if the bow shooting them has Infinity.

features.name: Soul Powder
features.description:
Soul Powder is crafted with 3 Soul Sand and a Soul Bead (from the Wraiths feature, or a Magma Cream, if it's disabled).

When right clicked it'll create a spirit, which will fly in the direction of the nearest nether fortress.

features.name: Note Block Interface
features.description:
Note Blocks get an interface when right clicked. A piano button layout shows up where you can set the note that the block will play. If you prefer the vanilla clicks system, you can click the note block icon to mimic that behaviour, and each note button has the amount of clicks needed under the note name.

Other players will hear you using the interface, and the piano keys are all keybound, so you can use it to play songs ingame, if you want to!

features.name: L to Lock Rotation
features.description:
Pressing the L key (rebindable) will lock a rotation, and optionally a block half, if you're looking at a block. Any further blocks placed are changed to that direction, regardless of how you were facing when placing them. This can be very useful for building with blocks that have awkward rotation methods, such as stairs or pistons.

To unlock the rotation press the key again while holding Shift.
